column13: Description
It’s possible to deliberately stoke the fires of Violence in Kami by traumatizing them in a very specific set of ways.
Refusal to die is a healthy trait.
"Why not make some money while we’re at it?”
A true professional understands how to play to their strengths.
Baby shark, doo-doo, doo-doo, doo-doo.
Careful assessment can allow a Kami to move into a Node more quickly. A product of experience…
More fighting, more violence, more fighting, more violence.
Edward Kamin, but sexier…
It isn’t so much a profession as it is a way of life.
You just want it more.
Sheer will-to-hurt continues to go a long way.
Though the craft has evolved with its medium, swift killing remains a cherished art form.
Some Kami are particularly talented at preying on the weaknesses of others. They’re just like human beings in that way.
Your Kami is always ready to bandage up in case of a counter-liquidation…. Meaning they can hold on to a little more musu.
Your Kami is really, really good at milking all possible profit from their targets.
A paragon of pure aggression. This Kamigotchi will overpower almost any other when it comes to raw strength.
Liquidating a Kamigotchi requires a certain firmness of intent. This is that kind of intent.
A fully-trained Assassin can enter a node almost instantly. The complacent should live in fear.
Did you drink water today? Please drink water.
While Kamigotchi aren’t exactly material beings, regular exercise has been proven to improve their stamina. We’re not sure why.
Some texts from the old world refer to a similar concept, roughly translated as “breedability.”
It’s important to focus one’s mind on the bags.
The Buteyko method emphasizes the importance of nasal breathing, which protects the airways by humidifying, warming, and cleaning the air entering the lungs.
With enough concentration Kamigotchi can stave off their own death if only for a bit longer.
An element of self care. Investing in it is known to help recover one’s energy levels and physical health.
Even a light warmup can offer a significant edge in physically intensive activities.
Your jawline never looked so good.
One does not simply achieve higher states of mind. Only after struggle and release.
Or, for boys, why not blast your music while going 120mph on the highway? You don’t need this.
Like many of life’s trials, Musu harvesting is often more of a marathon than a sprint.
Wolverine can do it. Starfish and salamanders can too. Stop saying “can’t” you pathetic nugget.
5 day split for the Serious builders.
You get things done.
Mastery of action-without-action allows you to make a little more money, with no effort. Not bad.
Cardio for the hardcore.
In the same way that gliding is flying.
Training a Kamigotchi in a certain degree of closed-mindedness can help to maintain inner peace.
Without any milk.
Your Kamigotchi believes the virtuous should be rewarded.
When preparing for the worst, the details matter.
All forms, especially libido, are a sign of good health.
Hard body. Battle tested. Able-to-take-a-beating kinda Kami.
aaaaAAAAaaaAaAAaAaaaaa
Survival is one thing, but another is knowing how to die effectively.
bark bark arf grrr awoof awooo

Your Kami shows up 5 minutes early to literally everything.
Back in my day this used to cost 30 tree branches and 50 firewood.
All that intensive physical training has built up some Violence…
Raw physical mass can be a form of talent, too.
Unbreakable.
“Not a radical loss of touch with reality.”
Your Kami gets every single ounce of juice from their Health points.
Compulsive and intrusive. But hardly a disorder.
The children long for the mines…
Good fashion choices can be the first step on the road to massively outsized gains.
Your Kami just want it more.
Negatively correlated assets have proven a great way to diversify risk in your Kamigotchi’s holdings.
Your Kamigotchi has learned to drive taxi while harvesting, increasing their MUSU gains.

Your Kami keeps muttering about Fibonacci retracement levels. You think it may have some form of schizophrenia, but it’s making more money this way.
Leopold II. Hideki Tojo. George Hudson.
You know how to maximise your own use of time and energy.

For men destined to define eras and change history, who will be remembered for millennia to come.
Benjamin Graham. Jim Simons. Roaring Kitty.
